channel.title: NPR Topics: Economy
channel.description: NPR news on the U.S. and world economy, the World Bank, and Federal Reserve. Commentary on economic trends. Subscribe to NPR Economy podcasts and RSS feeds.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Trump excoriates Supreme Court justices after tariff loss
item.description: The battle over the tariffs began on day one of the president's second term when he signed an executive order that let him impose a wide range of tariffs on virtually every U.S. trading partner.
item.content:encoded:
The battle over the tariffs began on day one of the president's second term when he signed an executive order that let him impose a wide range of tariffs on virtually every U.S. trading partner.

(Image credit: Kevin Dietsch)
item.dc:creator: Nina Totenberg

item.title: The 'doom loop' helps explain why the global economy is growing bleaker
item.description: How come it feels like it's all bad news in the global economy these days? According to one economist, something he calls the "doom loop."
item.content:encoded: How come it feels like it's all bad news in the global economy these days? According to one economist, something he calls the "doom loop."
item.dc:creator: Darian Woods

item.title: How the Supreme Court's tariffs ruling could affect the economy
item.description: The Supreme Court ruled that Trump overstepped his authority when he ordered widespread tariffs using a 1970s "emergency" statute. Here's how tariffs have impacted the economy.
item.content:encoded: The Supreme Court ruled that Trump overstepped his authority when he ordered widespread tariffs using a 1970s "emergency" statute. Here's how tariffs have impacted the economy.
item.dc:creator: Scott Horsley

item.title: 7 key things to know about Trump's tariffs after the Supreme Court decision
item.description: The Supreme Court ruled Friday that President Trump overstepped his authority in ordering tariffs on nearly everything the U.S. imports. Here's some economic context to understand that decision.
item.content:encoded:
The Supreme Court ruled Friday that President Trump overstepped his authority in ordering tariffs on nearly everything the U.S. imports. Here's some economic context to understand that decision.

(Image credit: Mario Tama)
item.dc:creator: Scott Horsley

item.title: The economy slowed in the last 3 months of the year — but was still solid in 2025
item.description: The U.S. economy grew 2.2% in 2025, a modest slowdown from 2.4% the previous year. GDP gains were fueled by solid consumer spending and business investment.
item.content:encoded:
The U.S. economy grew 2.2% in 2025, a modest slowdown from 2.4% the previous year. GDP gains were fueled by solid consumer spending and business investment.

(Image credit: Jeremy Weine)
item.dc:creator: Scott Horsley

item.title: U.S. economy slowed in final months of last year, but continued to expand
item.description: A report from the Commerce Department shows the economy grew at an annual rate of 1.4% in October, November and December. That compares to a 4.4% pace the previous quarter.
item.content:encoded: A report from the Commerce Department shows the economy grew at an annual rate of 1.4% in October, November and December. That compares to a 4.4% pace the previous quarter.
item.dc:creator: Scott Horsley

item.title: Amazon dethrones Walmart as the world's biggest company by sales
item.description: In a slow-motion race of two retail behemoths, Amazon's trump card was its lucrative cloud-computing business.
item.content:encoded:
In a slow-motion race of two retail behemoths, Amazon's trump card was its lucrative cloud-computing business.

(Image credit: Justin Sullivan)
item.dc:creator: Alina Selyukh

item.title: The record-breaking cocaine boom — and its deadly fallout
item.description: Cocaine has made a roaring comeback, and it's having some big negative effects in the U.S. and around the world.
item.content:encoded:
Cocaine has made a roaring comeback, and it's having some big negative effects in the U.S. and around the world.

(Image credit: LUIS ROBAYO)
item.dc:creator: Greg Rosalsky

item.title: How Trump's tariffs push some importers into risky, high-cost loans
item.description: President Trump's tariffs can create a cash crunch for importers. They have to pay the tariff bill before they can sell their products. Some have turned to a costly form of credit. But what looks like a helping hand can turn out to be a financial chokehold.
item.content:encoded: President Trump's tariffs can create a cash crunch for importers. They have to pay the tariff bill before they can sell their products. Some have turned to a costly form of credit. But what looks like a helping hand can turn out to be a financial chokehold.
item.dc:creator: Scott Horsley

item.title: 6 GOP reps defy Trump to block Canadian tariffs. And, student loan defaults rise
item.description: Six House Republicans joined Democrats to successfully block Trump's Canadian tariffs. And, roughly a million borrowers defaulted on their federal student loans last year.
item.content:encoded:
Six House Republicans joined Democrats to successfully block Trump's Canadian tariffs. And, roughly a million borrowers defaulted on their federal student loans last year.

(Image credit: Katherine KY Cheng)
item.dc:creator: Suzanne Nuyen
